result.execSummary:
The defendant Preston T. Harris-Cook was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: with 15CF359 and concurrently with current prison sentence now serving.

miscConds.notes: Defendant shall obtain and maintain full-time employment or education.

Defendant shall have no contact directly or indirectly with S.L.B. and K.G.
Defendant shall have no contact with any juvenile other than his family members.

Defendant shall submit to any assessments and fully participate in any counseling deemed appropriate by the Agent and abide by any treatment recommendations.
Defendant shall comply with sex offender registry requirements for a period of 15 years.
Provide biological specimen to State Crime Lab for DNA analysis.
Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety, unless defendant has completed AODA and upon Agent's approval.
Credit for 3 days, if probation revoked.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

superMiscConds.notes:
Defendant shall not possess or consume any intoxicating substances, including alcohol, unless Agent determines it appropriate following an appropriate screening.
Defendant to have no contact directly or indirectly with Katelyn M. Gerhartz.
Pay unpaid balances - to be determined by DOC.
